chunks.original_text: 《太上中黄真经》：内含胎仙道自成，胎息真仙食气得，却闭真气成胎息。 雷霆一窍图 抱朴子云：玄牝一窍，非心贤鼻口、肝肺、谷道、膀胱、泥丸。 知此一窍，则冬至药物，火候沐浴，脱胎结体，皆在此矣。 此窍雷霆之窍，得之则雷霆之枢机不必外求也。 至人用此，所以冲举。 希贤曰：○佛仙修行径路，大道不二法门。 坎为命宗，阴中有阳，真空交妙有也。 妙有为体，真空为用焉。 离为性宗，阳中有阴，妙有交真空也。 真空为体，妙有为用焉。 佛中有命脉，道中有性源。 性命交参，空有摄无。 老子即释迦，释迦即老子。 生於空劫之先，为性命之祖。 自后语言一立，各成异教。 故偏於命者，必落空亡。 偏於性者，必堕阴向。 致使大道殊途，异端竞起，而不能究竟於性命本源矣。 吾夫子曰：穷理尽性，乃至於命。 是以天下无二道，圣人无两心。 性之与命，不可须臾离也。 玉溪真人曰：前真有云：只明真性不修丹，万劫应知变化难。 不明真性只究命，此是修行第一病。 既到此处，不妨进步。 如道光禅师欲访张紫阳，却遇石杏林，始得玄宗一家，二妙了了，遂作《复命篇》行于世矣。 昔有僧问智门，如何是般若体？ 门云：蚌含秋月。 如何般若用？ 门云：兔子怀胎。 后雪窦有颂云：一片虚凝绝猬情，人天从此见空生。 蚌含玄兔深深意，曾与禅家作战争。 寒山诗曰：心月自精明，万象何能比？ 欲知仙丹术，身内元神是。 寒山诗曰：益者益其精，可名为有益。 易者易其形，是名之有易。 能益复能易，当得上仙籍。 无益复无易，终不免死厄。 毗陵禅师《复命篇》曰：余幼年学道，，所亲无非理性之士，若禅宗之上乘，一悟直超佛地。 如其习漏未尽，则尚循於生死。 至於坐脱立亡，投胎夺舍，未见一朝而长往。 常思仲尼穷理尽性以至於命，释氏不生不灭，老氏升腾飞举，由是圣人之意，不可一途而取之。 仆之得遇至人口诀曰：大道之祖，不出一炁而成变化。 仆一闻不疑，依法行之，果跻圣位。 颖滨苏氏曰； 命者，性之妙也。 性犹可言，至於命则不可言矣。 《易》曰：穷理尽性以至於命。 圣人之学道，必始於穷理，中於尽性，终於复命矣。 晦庵朱子读道书，作：岩谷秉贞操，所慕在玄虚。 清夜眠斋宇，终朝观道书，形忘气自冲，性达理不余。 於道虽未已，庶超名迹拘，至乐在襟怀，山水非所娱，寄语狂驰子，营营竟焉如。 又诵经，作：坐厌尘累积，脱洒味幽玄。 静披笈中素，流咏东华篇。 朝昏一俯仰，岁月如奔川。 世纷未云遣，仗此息诸缘。 又久雨斋居诵经，作：端居独无事，聊披释氏书。 暂释尘累牵，超然与道俱。 门掩竹林幽，禽呜山雨余。 了此无为法，身心同晏如。 右三诗，并见晦庵《朱文公大全文集》。 先生扶纲常，益世教，则指为异端，至於穷理尽性则非矣。 夫三圣之道，体同而用殊。 夫子毋意毋必毋固毋我，释氏无二无尽，老氏无思无为，同一理也。 先生之诗，殊途而同归，是故天下无二道。 知我罪我，其唯先也生之诗乎。 横纵雷霆九宫图令 希夷陈先生《龙图》曰：戴九履一，左三右七，二四为肩，六八为足。 希贤曰：雷霆九官，乃纵横十五之数。 伏羲氏观河图而画卦，即其数也。
chunks.translated_text:
*«The Scripture of the Supreme Middle-Yellow True Classic*» states:
*"The Dao of self-perfected fetal transcendence lies within—
The True Daoists nourish the *qi* through fetal breathing,
Retaining and closing the True *qi* to forge fetal breath.
The thunderous aperture is but one orifice."*

Master *Bao Pu* says:
*"The mysterious womb’s single orifice
Is neither the heart, nor the nose and mouth,
Nor the liver and lungs, nor the alimentary canal,
Nor the bladder, nor the *niwan* [脑海].
Knowing this one orifice,
Then winter solstice medicines, fire refining baths,
And shedding the fetal form to solidify the body—
All depend upon it.
This is the thunderous aperture,
And he who attains it
Need not seek the pivot of thunderous transformations elsewhere.
The Perfect Man employs this,
Thus he ascends with effortless might."*

Hixian says:
*"○ The paths of the Buddhas and Daoists are one—
The Great Dao holds no dual gateway.
*Kan* [坎] is the root of life,
Within yin lies yang,
And the interplay of True Emptiness with Marvelous Existence.
Marvelous Existence is their essence,
True Emptiness their function.

*Li* [离] is the root of nature,
Within yang lies yin,
And the interplay of Marvelous Existence with True Emptiness.
True Emptiness is their essence,
Marvelous Existence their function.

Within the Buddha lies the life-force,
Within the Dao lies the source of nature.
Nature and life intertwine,
Emptiness and existence encompass all.

Laozi is Śākyamuni,
Śākyamuni is Laozi.
Born before the Void-age,
He is the progenitor of nature and life.
Once language arose,
Distinct teachings emerged.
Thus, those who lean solely toward life-force
Must fall into emptiness and ruin.
Those who lean solely toward nature
Must sink into darkness and decline.

This leads to divergent paths in the Great Dao,
And competing heresies arise,
Yet none can ultimately grasp
The true source of nature and life.

Our Master Confucius says:
*'Exhaust the principles and perfect the nature,*
*Then one attains the life-force.*
Thus, under heaven there is but one Dao,
And the Sage holds but a single mind.
Nature and life cannot be parted,
Even for a moment.'

The True Person of Jade Creek says:
*'The ancients said: If you only clarify the True Nature but do not refine the elixir,
Even ten thousand kalpas you must know transformation is difficult.
If you only exhaust the life-force but fail to grasp the True Nature,
This is the first illness of cultivation.
Yet once you reach this point,
Do not hesitate to advance further.
Like Master Zhang Ziyang’s desire to visit Dao Guang Chan,
He instead encountered Shi Xinglin,
And thus attained the One Family of the Mysterious Essence,
The Two Marvels of clarity,
And composed the *Restoration of Life-Force* [《复命篇》] for the world.'

In ancient times, a monk asked Zhimen [智门]:
*'How is the essence of Prajñā?*
Zhimen replied:
*'A clam embracing the autumn moon.'

*'How is the function of Prajñā?*
Zhimen replied:
*'A hare bearing its young.'

Later, Master Xuedou composed a verse:
*'A single void, congealed yet free of all clinging,
From which all humans and gods perceive birth from emptiness.
The clam holds the hare of mystery deep within,
Once warring with the Chan school over this truth.'

Han Shan’s verse says:
*'The heart’s moon shines ever bright,
What can all phenomena compare to?
To know the art of the Daoist elixir,
The original spirit within the body is the key.'

Han Shan’s verse says:
*'To benefit, preserve the essence—
This is called "having benefit."
To transform, alter the form—
This is called "having transformation."
If one can both benefit and transform,
Then surely the register of the High Immortals is attained.
If neither benefit nor transformation is achieved,
Then death’s calamity is inevitable.*

Master Pi Ling’s *Restoration of Life-Force* says:
*'In my youth, I studied the Dao,
And all my teachers were men of nature’s essence.
The Chan school’s highest attainment—
A single insight directly transcends the Buddha’s realm.
If their practice is still incomplete,
They remain bound to birth and death.
As for seated transcendence or standing death,
Or seizing the fetus to snatch the shell,
I have never seen one achieve this in an instant.
I often pondered how Zhongni [仲尼, Confucius]
Exhausted principles and perfected nature to attain the life-force,
And how the Śākyamuni [释迦] taught
Neither birth nor annihilation,
While Laozi [老子] spoke of
Ascending and soaring with effortless might.
Thus, the Sage’s intent
Cannot be taken by a single path alone.

The secret I received from the Perfect Man was:
*"The progenitor of the Great Dao
Is none other than the One *Qi* [一炁],
From which all transformations arise."*
Upon hearing this, I doubted not,
Followed the method, and indeed ascended to the Sage’s rank.*

Master Su of Yingbin says:
*'The life-force is the marvel of nature.
Nature can still be spoken of,
But the life-force cannot be spoken of at all.*
The *Yijing* says:
*"Exhaust the principles and perfect the nature,
Then one attains the life-force."*
The Sage’s study of the Dao
Must begin with exhausting the principles,
Progress through perfecting the nature,
And culminate in restoring the life-force.

Master Huai’an Zhuzi [晦庵朱子] read the Daoist texts and composed:
*"In the rocky valley, I uphold steadfast virtue,
Aspiring only to the Mysterious and Void.
On clear nights, I rest in the hallowed chamber,
All day long, I study the Daoist teachings.
The body forgets itself, and the *qi* ascends naturally;
The nature is realized, and the principles leave no trace.
Though I have not yet mastered the Dao,
I escape the shackles of fame and reputation,
Finding joy in the depths of my mind—
Mountains and waters cannot entertain me.
I speak to the maddened seeker:
Your ceaseless striving is in vain."*

Again, in reciting the scriptures, he composed:
*"Weary of the dust’s encumbrances,
I cast them off, embracing the profound Mysterious.
Silently unfolding the unadorned texts,
I chant the verses of the Eastern Marvels.
Morning and evening, a single bow—
Years pass like a rushing stream.
Though the world’s chaos remains,
I rely on this to sever all ties."*

And during long rains, in secluded meditation while reciting scriptures, he composed:
*"Residing alone, I have no affairs,
Casually unfolding the Śākyamuni’s texts.
Temporarily releasing the dust’s entanglements,
I transcend with the Dao as my companion.
The gate is shut in the bamboo grove’s seclusion,
Birds call in the lingering mountain rain.
Having grasped the Law of Non-Action,
Body and mind rest in perfect harmony."*

*The three poems above appear in Master Huai’an’s *Complete Works of Zhu Wen Gong* [《朱文公大全文集》].
The Master often upheld the orthodoxy,
And benefited the world’s teachings—
Yet when he exhausted the principles and perfected the nature,
He was no longer constrained by such norms.
The three Sages’ Dao
Differs in function yet shares the same essence.
Confucius taught without intention, necessity, rigidity, or ego,
The Śākyamuni taught without duality or exhaustion,
Laozi taught without thought or action—
All three spoke of the same principle.

The Master’s poems
Diverge in path yet converge in meaning,
Thus under heaven there is but one Dao.
Who else but the Master’s poems
Can both know and condemn me?
The diagram of the *Lo Shu* [《纵横雷霆九宫图》] says:

Hixian Chen says in *The Dragon Diagram* [《龙图》]:
*"Wear the Nine on your head and the One on your feet,
Three to the left and Seven to the right,
Two and Four as shoulders,
Six and Eight as feet."*

Hixian says:
*"The Nine Palaces of Thunderous Lo Shu
Are the fifteen numbers of the *Lo Shu* arrangement.
The Yellow Emperor observed the River Diagram and drew the trigrams,
Which are based on these very numbers."*

chunks.original_text: 震三兑七，中宫五十五数也。 艮八坤二，中宫五十五数也。 乾六巽四，中宫五十五数也。 坎一离九，中宫五十五数也。 纵横妙用，皆成十五，乃得阴阳之备数。 故《乾凿》云：老阳之策九，老阴之策六，九六亦十五之数。 雷字亦十五画而成之，故曰阴阳击搏之谓雷。 戊癸玄化之图 甲庚为之 丙为之 壬为之 卯为之 子为之 惟戈癸 希贤曰：东方甲木属震，震为春为雷，生化万物也。 西方庚金属兑，为秋为霆，肃杀万物也。 故雷霆司号令之权，春生秋杀终，始万物者也。 《易》曰：天不言而品物亨，岁功成矣。 丙属离，离为火，火旺於丙午，故为雷火之会。 离中虚，恍恍惚惚，杳杳冥冥。 经云：恍惚裹相逢，杳冥中出变，一霎火焰飞，真人自出现。 壬隶乾，乾乃雷 之所，伏而为雷之局也。 《玉枢雷书》曰：伏乾出巽，体元工是也。 卯为震，木震为雷，生於亥，旺於卯，卯为雷之门，雷至卯月方有声。 《月令》曰：仲春之月，雷乃发声是也。 子为十一月之支，冬至在焉。 为地雷复卦 ，上坤下震，一阳初生於五阴之下，阳炁尚微，故闭肩安静以养阳也。 《易》曰：先王於至日，闭关是也。 戊癸化火者，非五行书所谓也。 坎乃天一真精之水，坎中有戊有癸而化生真火。 虚中为雷火之司，总御四序，控制五行，是雷霆之主也。 《庄子》曰：有雷有霆，水中有火是也。 雷霆运用之图 运雷之法，人咸知其握固掩耳矣。 不知所以握固掩耳为何？ 要得一点雷霆之根，腾腾运动，得其门户而出风雨，雷电自此而发，非假乎嘘呵。 印闪可合先天大道之用。 即此运审，与父母朱生前无以异也。 岂宜以寻常平易之说而忽之。 杨子《法言》曰：圣人有以拟天地而参诸身。 康节邵子曰：吹啧嘘呵，呼风雨云雾，雷言相类也。 又曰：云行雨施，电开雷震，亦各从其类也。 《内经素问》曰：风炁通於肝，雷炁通於心，雨炁通於肾。 清阳为天，浊阴为地。 地炁上为云，天炁下为雨。 雨出地炁，云出天炁。 五子归庚图 无上元君得九五之道，而帝雷霆九五之道者，自北而东，目子而已，皆阳道也。 所以统天，荣枯万物，起灭四时，五雷君得三五之道，亦无殊於九五，皆雷霆道也。 希贤曰：五子归庚者，一三五七九，皆阳数也，合而为二十有五，故《易》曰天数二十有五。 夫五子归庚，所以为万物之主宰。 东方自壬子而归庚，乃九数也。 北方丙子归庚，五数也。 南方戊子归庚，三数也。 西方甲子归庚，七数也。 中央庚子归庚，一数也。 得天数之正焉，乃雷霆之道也。 大衍之数图 雷霆得天地之中炁，故号五雷。 道书云：东三南二同成五； 北一西方四共之。 戊己还归本生数，三家相见结婴儿。 既成圣胎，即五雷君也。 一三五七九，阳奇数也《易》曰天二四六八十，阴偶数也，地数三十是焉。 天地之数，总成五十有五，阴阳之数备矣。 太衍之数五十者，去五为五行之本。 其用四十有九者，又去一以象太极不动之义。 刘牧《钩隐》曰：一与五合而为六，二与五合而为七，三与五合而为八，四与五合而为九，五与五合而为十。 一六为水，二七为火，三八为木，四九为金，五十为土，即五五也。 杨雄《太玄》曰：一与六共宗，二与七为朋，三与八成友，四与九同道，五与十相守。

The trigrams *Zhèn* (三) and *Duì* (七) combine to form the central palace’s fifty-five numbers.
The trigrams *Gèn* (八) and *Kūn* (二) likewise form the central palace’s fifty-five numbers.
*Qián* (六) and *Xùn* (四) do the same.
*Kǎn* (一) and *Lí* (九) likewise complete the fifty-five numbers of the central palace.

The marvelous applications of the *Lo Shu* arrangement all sum to fifteen,
Thus achieving the complete numbers of yin and yang.
Hence, *The Drilling of the Primordial* [《乾凿度》] states:
*"The strategy of Old Yang is Nine, the strategy of Old Yin is Six—
Nine and Six are the numbers of fifteen."*

The character *léi* (雷) is composed of fifteen strokes,
Thus it is said: *"Yin and yang striking and clashing—this is thunder."*

**The Diagram of Stealthy Transformation by Wuji and Guiji**
Established by *Jiǎ* (甲) and *Gēng* (庚),
By *Bǐng* (丙), *Rén* (壬), and *Mǎo* (卯),
By *Zǐ* (子)—
Only *Wuji* (戊) and *Guiji* (癸) are included.

Hixian says:
*"The East belongs to *Jiǎ* (甲), the Wood of *Zhèn* (震),
Which is Spring and Thunder, generating and transforming all things.
The West belongs to *Gēng* (庚), the Metal of *Duì* (兑),
Which is Autumn and Thunderous Peals, austerely killing all things.
Thus, thunder and thunderous peals hold the authority of command,
Spring generates, Autumn kills—
They are the origin of all things.
The *Classic of Changes* says:
*'Heaven speaks not, yet all things prosper—
The year’s work is complete.'*

*Bǐng* (丙) belongs to *Lí* (离), the Fire that flourishes at *Bǐngwǔ* (丙午).
Thus, it is the convergence of thunder and fire.
Within *Lí* (离) is emptiness—
Vague and indistinct, dim and murky.
The scripture says:
*'Vague and indistinct, we meet in illusion,
Dim and murky, transformations arise—
A flash of fire blazes forth,
And the True Person emerges.'*

*Rén* (壬) is subject to *Qián* (乾), the domain of thunder,
Where it lies dormant as the formation of thunder.
*The Jade Pivot Thunder Scripture* [《玉枢雷书》] says:
*'The hidden *Qián* (乾) emerges as *Xùn* (巽)—
This is the embodiment of the Primordial Worker.'*

*Mǎo* (卯) is *Zhèn* (震), Wood as thunder,
Born at *Hài* (亥), flourishing at *Mǎo* (卯).
*Mǎo* (卯) is the gate of thunder—
Only when the month of *Mǎo* (卯) arrives does thunder sound.
*The Monthly Ordinances* [《月令》] says:
*'In the second month of Spring, thunder begins to sound.'*

*Zǐ* (子) is the eleventh branch, where Winter Solstice resides.
It is the *Earth Thunder Recovering* [《地雷复》] hexagram—
*Kūn* (坤) above, *Zhèn* (震) below,
Where one yang first arises beneath five yin.
The yang *qi* is still faint,
Thus the shoulders are closed and still to nurture the yang.
The *Classic of Changes* says:
*'The ancient kings, on the Winter Solstice, closed the gates.'*

Wuji (戊) and Guiji (癸) transform into fire—not as recorded in the *Five Phases* texts.
*Kǎn* (坎) is the true essence of Heaven’s One—water.
Within *Kǎn* (坎) are Wuji (戊) and Guiji (癸), which generate true fire.
The void within governs thunder and fire,
Overseeing the four seasons and controlling the Five Phases—
This is the master of thunder and thunderous peals.
*Zhuangzi* says:
*'There is thunder and thunderous peals—
Fire within water.'*

**The Diagram of Thunder and Thunderous Peals in Motion**
The method of summoning thunder—
All know to clench the fists and cover the ears.
But why does one clench the fists and cover the ears?
To grasp the root of thunder and thunderous peals,
Vigorously moving, entering through its gate,
And thus unleashing wind and rain—
Thunder and lightning arise from this, not from mere exhalations.
The seal and flash align with the Primordial Dao’s use.
Through this practice, one attains the same as the parents, Zhu Sheng [朱生].
How could one dismiss this with ordinary, simplistic explanations?

Yang Zhu’s *Law of Speech* [《法言》] says:
*'The Sage models Heaven and Earth, then applies it to the body.'*

Kang Zhi Shao [邵康节] says:
*'Blowing, puffing, exhaling, and inhaling—
Summoning wind, rain, clouds, and mist—
Their speech resembles thunder.'*
He also says:
*'Clouds move, rain descends, lightning splits, thunder crashes—
Each follows its kind.'*

*The Yellow Emperor’s Inner Classic* [《内经素问》] says:
*'Wind-*qi *communicates with the liver, thunder-*qi *with the heart, rain-*qi *with the kidneys.
Clear yang is Heaven, turbid yin is Earth.
Earth-*qi *ascends as clouds, Heaven-*qi *descends as rain.
Rain emerges from Earth-*qi*, clouds from Heaven-*qi*.'*

**The Diagram of the Five Sons Returning to Gēng (庚)**
The Most High Sovereign Lord obtained the *Nine-Five* Dao,
And the Emperor of Thunder obtained the *Nine-Five* Dao—
From the North to the East, only *Zǐ* (子) is included,
All of which are yang paths.
Thus, it governs Heaven,
Nurtures and withers all things,
Gives rise to and extinguishes the four seasons.
The Five Thunder Lords obtain the *Three-Five* Dao,
Which does not differ from the *Nine-Five*—
All are the Dao of thunder and thunderous peals.

Hixian says:
*'The Five Sons returning to Gēng (庚)—
One, Three, Five, Seven, Nine are all yang numbers,
Combined, they make twenty-five—
Thus the *Classic of Changes* says: "Heaven’s numbers are twenty-five."
The Five Sons returning to Gēng (庚) are the sovereign rulers of all things.
From the East, *Rénzǐ* (壬子) returns to Gēng (庚)—
This is the Nine number.
From the North, *Bǐngzǐ* (丙子) returns to Gēng (庚)—
This is the Five number.
From the South, *Wùzǐ* (戊子) returns to Gēng (庚)—
This is the Three number.
From the West, *Jiǎzǐ* (甲子) returns to Gēng (庚)—
This is the Seven number.
From the Center, *Gēngzǐ* (庚子) returns to Gēng (庚)—
This is the One number.
Thus, the true numbers of Heaven are obtained—
This is the Dao of thunder and thunderous peals.'*

**The Diagram of the Great Unfolding’s Numbers**
Thunder and thunderous peals obtain the central *qi* of Heaven and Earth,
Thus they are called the Five Thunders.
The Dao scriptures say:
*'East Three, South Two—together they make Five;
North One, West Four—together they make Nine.
Wuji (戊) and Jǐ (己) return to their original generating numbers,
The Three Families meet to form the Infant.'*
Once the Sacred Embryo is formed,
It becomes the Five Thunder Lords.

One, Three, Five, Seven, Nine—these are the yang odd numbers.
The *Classic of Changes* says:
*'Heaven’s numbers are Two, Four, Six, Eight, Ten—
The yin even numbers,
And Earth’s numbers are thirty.'*
The numbers of Heaven and Earth total fifty-five—
The complete numbers of yin and yang are achieved.

The Great Unfolding’s fifty numbers,
Subtracting Five leaves the Five Phases’ roots.
Their use in forty-nine,
Again subtracting One symbolizes the immovable *Tai Ji*.

Liu Mu’s *Hooked and Hidden* [《钩隐》] says:
*'One combined with Five makes Six,
Two combined with Five makes Seven,
Three combined with Five makes Eight,
Four combined with Five makes Nine,
Five combined with Five makes Ten.
One and Six are Water,
Two and Seven are Fire,
Three and Eight are Wood,
Four and Nine are Metal,
Five and Ten are Earth—
This is the Five-Five.'*

*'One and Six share the same origin,
Two and Seven are companions,
Three and Eight are friends,
Four and Nine follow the same path,
Five and Ten guard each other.'*

Chen Xiqí said:
The Great Unfolding’s numbers—forty-nine in use, while One is suspended and unused—its meaning.
Scholars merely know that One symbolizes the immovable *Tai Ji*, yet they fail to grasp its true significance.
Why? Because One is the fundamental root of all numbers.
All things’ principles: without a root, they are disordered; with a root, they must not be overused, for overuse brings chaos again.
Take, for instance, the motion of a cart—when its axle is centered, it stops.
Or a chariot’s wheels—when they are large, they move.
Like a net’s central cord, which is drawn taut.
Like a vessel’s handle, which is grasped.
Like the sovereign’s authority, with hands and feet acting beneath.
Like a general commanding from the center, with soldiers obeying.
Like the Sage-Emperor’s non-action, while ministers act.
Like the wise being honored, while the capable are employed—
Thus, all who grasp One are its root, its foundation, its master.
All possess the unchanging principle of unity; if moved, the rest fall into disorder.

Yichuan Chengzi said:
The Great Unfolding’s numbers total fifty.
Numbers begin at One and complete at Five; the lesser Unfolding forms Ten, while the greater Unfolding makes fifty.
When fifty is complete, it is immovable, hence One is subtracted for use.
The numbers of Heaven and Earth are fifty, with five completing their transformations and animating the spirits.
*Transformations* refer to function; *spirits* refer to application.
*King Fang’s I Ching* states:
Fifty refers to the ten solar terms, twelve earthly branches, and twenty-eight lunar mansions.
Of the fifty, the unused One is the Heavenly *qi*’s birth.

Zheng Xuan said:
The numbers of Heaven and Earth are harmonized through the Five Phases’ *qi*.
The Five Phases each contain five; the Great Unfolding subtracts one, thus using forty-nine.
The Five Phases’ *qi* harmonized refers to the ten solar terms, twelve lunar tones, and twenty-eight lunar mansions—through which the Five Phases’ *qi* flows.
Fifty-five in total, subtracting five yields the Great Unfolding; again subtracting One gives forty-nine.
This doctrine originates from *The Buhrst Degrees*, aligning with King Fang’s view, though the Five Phases’ harmonized *qi* is even more refined.

*Guanzi’s I Ching* states:
Zhang Yi asked: The numbers of Heaven and Earth total fifty-five; yet you say fifty, then subtract One—what does this mean?
Guanzi replied: The *shu* divination stalks do not merely imitate Heaven and Earth; the Five Phases must operate within them.

Zhao Shuo said:
Its use of forty-nine—
The Great Unfolding is inexhaustible.
The subtraction of One demonstrates its inexhaustibility.

---
**Five Phases Inversion Diagram**
When the Five Phases are disordered, the tiger walks in water.
**Five Phases Inversion Technique**
The dragon emerges from fire’s embrace.

Zhongyang Zhang Zhenren said:
The Five Phases inverted—
The elixir body ever refined.
Shi Chen Wang Zhenren said:
Linked cycles, sequential transformations—
The Five Phases’ essence is inversion.
Master the intent of inversion within,
And thunderbolts strike from azure dawn.

*Inversion* refers to reversing the Five Phases,
Harmonizing the Four Symbols,
Extracting the undifferentiated *qi* of the Primordial Void,
Seizing the essence of the Dragon and Tiger at their first union,
Entering the Yellow Chamber,
And birthing the supreme treasure—
Thus, formless gives rise to form,
The body beyond the body.
When virtue and merit are complete,
Ascension to the Celestial Immortal is attained.

*Order* is humanity’s great principle:
Dividing *jing* and *qi* to form the body,
*Qi* becomes matter, wandering spirits transform—
With a body comes suffering;
Tribulations arise from here.

*The Awakening to Reality* states:
If one seeks inversion in daily life,
Even the earth’s dust becomes treasure.

---
**Thunderbolt Transformation Diagram**
**Thunder**
Yin and Yang clash, forming thunder by law.
**Lightning**
Yin and Yang congeal, surging into lightning.
**Wind**
Yin weak, Yang strong—wind arises.
**Cloud**
Yin weak, Yang strong—wind arises.
**Snow**
Yin excessive, Yang deficient—clouds gather.
**Rain**
Yin and Yang ascending and descending—steamed into rain.
**Frost**
Yin oppressive, Yang collapsing—frost flies.
**Dew**
Yang flourishing, Yin dispersing—dew spreads faintly.
**Fog**
Ascending and descending fail—fog forms.
**Hail**
Yin and Yang stagnant—hail congeals.
**Rainbow**
Excess water becomes rainbow.
**Drought**
Excess fire becomes drought.

**Thunderbolt Essence and Function Ode**
Heaven and Earth’s void center ever open,
Only when dynamic stillness splits into Yin and Yang.
Life and death, opening and closing—
All inverted, the Dipper’s pivot steadfast.
Thunder’s clash erupts from the earth,
Lightning’s glow flashes golden.
Wind drifts, weak or strong, rising with time,
Strong or weak, clouds gather short or long.
Ascending and descending, steaming rain descends,
Soft snow falls on the silver hall.
Frost flies, oppressive Yin collapses—
Yang flourishing, dew scatters far.
When ascending and descending fail, fog forms;
Stagnant Yin, hail—no Yang.
Excess water becomes mirage, excess fire becomes drought.
Harmonized and balanced, all things flourish.
Stillness, divine wind—Heaven’s *qi* bright,
Ascending yet unrising—eternal truth.
Raging winds, sudden rains—Yin and Yang dance,
Winter warmth like summer’s heat, summer’s chill like winter’s frost.
Prolonged rain, endless drought—floods surge,
Thunder crashes in the tenth month, summer frost flies.
Self-crafted transformation unites Heaven and Earth,
Yet those who fail to grasp the pivot merely measure.

*The Soul Treasure’s Complete Methods* states:
Earth’s *qi* ascends, becoming cloud, dispersing as rain.
Heaven’s *qi* descends, dispersing as fog, congealing as dew.
Excessive Yin turns dew to frost, rain to snow.
Excessive Yang turns fog to mist, clouds to mist-haze.
Yin concealing Yang—Yang’s *qi* unchecked—
Clashing, it births thunderbolts.
Yang concealing Yin—Yang’s *qi* uncoalesced—
Firmly solidifying, it forms hail and sleet.
Yin and Yang unaligned—
Lightning strikes.
Yin and Yang mismatched—
The dragon transforms into rainbow.

Kangjie Shaozi said:
Yang obtains Yin and becomes rain;
Yin obtains Yang and becomes wind;
The firm obtains the yielding and becomes cloud;
The yielding obtains the firm and becomes thunder.

chunks.original_text: 无阴则不能为雨，无阳则不能为雷。 雨柔也，而属阴，阴不能独立，故待阳而后兴。 雷刚也，属阳，阳不能自用，必待阴而后发也。 《天地神交论》曰：积阴，阴过则露为霜，而雨为雪。 积阳，阳过则雾为烟，而云为霞。 阴中伏阳，而生雷霆。 阳中伏阴，坚固而生雹子、霰。 阴阳不正，乱交而变虹。 《庄子》曰：大块噫气，其名为风，是为无作，作则万号窍怒。 希夷曰：震得乾初爻，故雷自天之下而发，观兑画则知雨自地出。 又曰：天炁下为雨。 又曰：坎，乾也，水也，气也。 坎井是也。 兑，坤水也，形也，今雨是也。 一阳陷二阴为坎，坎之气潜行於万物之中，为受命之根本。 故曰：润物者，莫润乎水。 横渠张子曰：阳炁正升，忽遇阴炁，则相持而下为雨。 盖阳炁轻，阴炁重，故阳黑为阴炁压坠而下也。 阴炁正升，忽遇阳炁，则助之飞腾，而上为云也。 阴炁凝聚，阳在内者不得出，则奋击而为雷霆。 阳炁伏於阴黑之内不得出，故爆开而为雷也。 阳在外不得入，则周旋不舍而为风。 阴炁凝结於内，阳炁欲入而不得，故旋绕於其外不已，而为风至，吹散阴炁，尽乃已也。 和而散，则为霜雪雨露。 不和而散，则为戾气随霾。 戾气飞雹之类，曀霾黄雾之属，皆阴阳邪恶不正之炁，所以雹水秽浊或青黑色。 晦庵朱子曰：雪花所以六出者，只是霰子被猛风拍开成棱瓣也。 又曰：六者阴数，太阴玄精石亦六棱，盖天自然之数。 又曰：龙水物也，其出而与阳炁交蒸，故能成雨。 但寻常雨，自是阴阳炁蒸郁而成，非必能龙为之。 只是下炁上升，未能为雨。 必是上炁蔽盖，无发泄处，方能成雨。 环溪吴氏曰：随风为巽，固也。 而风何以有炁？ 盖下四爻，坎象也。 五体之上，则离也。 水入火中，则相鼓而有气。 以物之小者推之，勺水以熄火，则火奋而气腾。 况坎离之大气乎？ 火之喜也，其声微，其气烈。 而瀑流激湍之傍，其声□灊则气凄冷，积微成着则水火之为风也。 信矣。 温风生於丙丁之月，而飓风生於海露，是不独雷怒而有声，彼万窍怒号，惟风亦然。 蕴极而蛰，蛰久而泄则为雷。 常泄则不极，不极则为风。 凡物之怒者，永有非水使之者也。 道法宗旨图衍义卷下竟

There is no Yin without the ability to become rain,
Nor no Yang without the ability to produce thunder.

Rain is yielding, yet belongs to Yin;
Yin cannot stand alone,
Thus it awaits Yang before it rises.
Thunder is firm, belonging to Yang;
Yang cannot act by itself,
And must await Yin before it erupts.

*The Treatise on Heaven and Earth’s Divine Interaction* states:
When Yin accumulates excessively, it turns dew to frost,
And rain to snow.
When Yang accumulates excessively, it turns fog to mist,
And clouds to mist-haze.
When Yin conceals Yang within,
Thunderbolts arise.
When Yang conceals Yin within,
It solidifies and births hail and sleet.
When Yin and Yang are unbalanced,
Their chaotic interaction produces the rainbow.

*Zhuangzi* says:
The Great Block exhales *qi*—its name is Wind,
Which is the state of no action.
When it acts, all openings roar with fury.

Xīyí [Kangjie Shaozi] says:
When *Zhen* obtains the initial line of *Qián* [Heaven],
Thunder erupts from beneath Heaven.
Observing the *Duì* [Lake] hexagram reveals
Rain emerges from the Earth.
Again, it says: Heaven’s *qi* descends as rain.
Again: *Kǎn* [Abyss] is Heaven, Water, and *qi*.
The *Kǎn* well is its manifestation.
*Duì* [Lake] is Earth’s Water, its form,
And now rain is its embodiment.
One Yang descending into two Yin forms *Kǎn*;
The *qi* of *Kǎn* subtly permeates all things,
As the foundation for receiving the Mandate.
Thus it is said: "None moisten things like Water."
*Yáng* [Yang] *qi* ascends upright,
Yet suddenly meets Yin *qi*—
They clash and descend as rain.
For Yang *qi* is light, Yin *qi* is heavy;
Thus Yang is pressed down by Yin *qi* and falls as rain.

Yin *qi* ascends upright,
Yet suddenly meets Yang *qi*—
It aids its flight and becomes cloud.
When Yin *qi* congeals and Yang is trapped within,
It lashes out and becomes thunderbolts.
When Yang *qi* is concealed within Yin’s depths,
It erupts violently as thunder.
When Yang remains outside and cannot enter,
It circles endlessly and becomes Wind.
When Yin *qi* congeals within,
And Yang *qi* seeks to enter but cannot,
It swirls around externally without rest,
And becomes the arrival of Wind,
Dispersing Yin *qi* until it ceases.
When harmony and dispersion occur,
It becomes frost, snow, rain, and dew.
When there is no harmony in dispersion,
It becomes *lì* [perverse] *qi* mingling with haze.
Hail, perverse *qi* in flight,
And the yellow mists of *mái* [filth],
All are Yin and Yang’s twisted, unbalanced *qi*,
Thus hailstones are foul and turbid—
Or green and black in hue.

Huì’ān [Zhu Xi] says:
The snowflake’s six-pointed form arises
When sleet is struck by fierce winds, forming prismatic petals.
Again: Six is the number of Yin,
The *Tài Yīn* [Great Yin] *Xuán Jīng* [Mysterious Essence] stone is also six-edged,
This is Nature’s inherent number.
Again: The dragon [rainbow] is a waterly phenomenon;
When it emerges and mingles with Yang *qi*,
It condenses and forms rain.
But ordinary rain is simply
The result of Yin and Yang *qi* condensing and rising—
Not necessarily requiring the dragon’s intervention.
It is merely the lower *qi* ascending,
Not yet forming rain.
Only when the upper *qi* is overwhelming,
With no outlet for release,
Can it truly become rain.

Huánxī [Wu Zhi] says:
Wind follows the *Xùn* [Wind] trigram—this is fixed.
Yet how does Wind possess *qi*?
The lower four lines represent the *Kǎn* [Abyss] hexagram.
The fifth line above is *Lǐ* [Fire].
When water enters fire, they agitate and produce *qi*.
Pushing this to the smallest of things,
A ladle of water extinguishes fire,
Yet fire rages and *qi* ascends.
How much more so for the vast *qi* of *Kǎn* and *Lǐ*?
Fire’s joy is subtle in sound,
Yet fierce in *qi*.
At the side of cascading torrents and surging rapids,
When the sound is **□** [missing character],
The *qi* becomes chilling and cold;
The accumulation of subtle forces
Condenses into Wind—
Thus water and fire become Wind.
Indeed.

The warm Wind arises in the months of *Bǐng* [3rd] and *Dīng* [4th],
While the *Jì* [typhoon] Wind arises from the sea’s *lù* [dew].
This is not only thunder raging with sound,
For all openings roar in fury—
Wind does so as well.
When *qi* is stored to its extreme and dormant,
Yet released after long suppression,
It becomes thunder.
Constant release prevents extreme storage;
Without extreme storage,
It becomes Wind.
All things that rage eternally
Are not solely water-driven.

*The Daoist Law of Principles: Diagram and Extended Commentary* concludes below.
